title: Endoparasite
description:
A parasite that lives inside the host
Example: Tapeworm

title: Ectoparasite
description:
A parasite that lives on the host's surface
Example: Fleas

title: Facultative Parasite
description:
A parasite that can live independently
Example: Naegleria

title: Obligate Parasite
description:
A parasite that must live in a host
Example: Malaria Parasite

title: Definitive Host
description:
The host where a parasite reaches maturity
Example: Mosquito for Plasmodium

title: Intermediate Host
description:
A host that supports a larval stage
Example: Snail for Schistosoma

title: Paratenic Host
description:
A host that carries a parasite but is not essential for development
Example: Rodents for Toxoplasma

title: Reservoir Host
description:
A host that naturally harbors a pathogen
Example: Dogs for Leishmania

title: Vector
description:
An organism that transmits pathogens
Example: Mosquito

title: Zoonotic Parasite
description:
A parasite capable of infecting humans and animals
Example: Toxoplasma

title: Helminth
description:
A parasitic worm
Example: Roundworms

title: Protozoan Parasite
description:
A single-celled parasitic organism
Example: Plasmodium

title: Ectoparasitic Infestation
description:
Infestation of the skin by parasites
Example: Lice

title: Trophozoite
description:
The active feeding stage of protozoa
Example: Giardia

title: Cyst
description:
A dormant, protective stage of protozoa
Example: Entamoeba

title: Encystment
description:
The process of forming a cyst
Example: Encysted Giardia

title: Excystation
description:
The emergence from a cyst
Example: Cyst Activation

title: Hyperparasitism
description:
A parasite living inside another parasite
Example: Hyperinfective Tapeworm

title: Epizootic
description:
A parasite outbreak in animal populations
Example: Avian Malaria

title: Chronic Infection
description:
A long-term infection
Example: Chronic Malaria

title: Host Specificity
description:
The range of hosts a parasite can infect
Example: Trypanosoma Hosts

title: Parasite Burden
description:
The number of parasites infecting a host
Example: High Worm Load

title: Antigenic Variation
description:
The ability to change antigens to evade immunity
Example: Trypanosome Variant Surface Glycoproteins

title: Pathogenicity
description:
The ability of a parasite to cause disease
Example: Plasmodium

title: Virulence
description:
The degree of harm caused by a parasite
Example: Yersinia Pestis

title: Latency
description:
A dormant but viable state of a pathogen
Example: Herpesvirus

title: Dormancy
description:
A state where a parasite remains inactive
Example: Latent Toxoplasma

title: Direct Life Cycle
description:
A life cycle requiring only one host
Example: Hookworm

title: Indirect Life Cycle
description:
A life cycle requiring multiple hosts
Example: Schistosoma

title: Schizogony
description:
Asexual reproduction in protozoa
Example: Plasmodium Replication

title: Cysticercosis
description:
A disease caused by larval tapeworms
Example: Pork Tapeworm

title: Hydatid Disease
description:
A disease caused by Echinococcus larvae
Example: Echinococcus

title: Filarial Infection
description:
A disease caused by filarial worms
Example: Wuchereria

title: Nematode
description:
A roundworm parasite
Example: Ascaris

title: Trematode
description:
A fluke parasite
Example: Fasciola

title: Cestode
description:
A tapeworm parasite
Example: Taenia

title: Microsporidia
description:
A fungal-like microparasite
Example: Nosema

title: Myiasis
description:
Infestation by fly larvae
Example: Botfly

title: Onchocerciasis
description:
A disease caused by Onchocerca worms
Example: River Blindness

title: Leishmaniasis
description:
A disease caused by Leishmania parasites
Example: Sandfly Fever

title: Rabies
description:
A viral disease causing fatal encephalitis
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Toxoplasmosis
description:
A protozoan infection affecting multiple species
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Brucellosis
description:
A bacterial infection from livestock
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Leptospirosis
description:
A bacterial disease spread through urine
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Anthrax
description:
A bacterial disease affecting animals and humans
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Lyme Disease
description:
A tick-borne bacterial disease
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Q Fever
description:
A bacterial disease from farm animals
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Echinococcosis
description:
A tapeworm infection
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Plague
description:
A bacterial infection from rodents
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Hantavirus
description:
A virus spread by rodents
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Nipah Virus
description:
A viral disease from bats and pigs
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Avian Influenza
description:
A bird flu virus
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Swine Flu
description:
A pig flu virus
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Bovine Tuberculosis
description:
A bacterial infection in cattle
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Salmonellosis

A bacterial infection from food

title: Campylobacteriosis

A bacterial infection from poultry
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

A hemorrhagic fever virus
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Ebola

A deadly virus from African bats

title: Zika Virus
description:
A mosquito-borne virus
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Yellow Fever
description:
A mosquito-borne viral infection
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: West Nile Virus
description:
A mosquito-borne virus affecting birds
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Rift Valley Fever
description:
A virus affecting livestock and humans
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Tularemia
description:
A bacterial disease from wild animals
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Chagas Disease
description:
A protozoan infection transmitted by insects
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Dengue Fever
description:
A mosquito-borne viral disease
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Japanese Encephalitis
description:
A mosquito-borne virus affecting the brain
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Crimean-Congo Hemorrhagic Fever
description:
A deadly tick-borne virus
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Monkeypox
description:
A viral disease from monkeys
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Hendra Virus
description:
A virus from horses and bats
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: SARS
description:
A coronavirus causing respiratory illness
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: MERS
description:
A respiratory virus from camels
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: COVID-19
description:
A coronavirus causing a global pandemic
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Bartonellosis
description:
A bacterial infection from fleas
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Psittacosis
description:
A bacterial infection from birds
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Trichinellosis
description:
A parasitic disease from raw meat
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Bovine Spongiform Encephalopathy
description:
A prion disease affecting cattle
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Leishmania Transmission
description:
A sandfly-borne parasite infection
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Toxocariasis
description:
A roundworm infection from pets
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Lymphocytic Choriomeningitis
description:
A rodent-borne viral disease
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Innate Immunity
description:
The body's first line of defense
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Adaptive Immunity
description:
A specialized immune response
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Humoral Immunity
description:
Immunity involving antibodies
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Cell-Mediated Immunity
description:
Immunity involving T cells
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Antibody
description:
A protein that binds to antigens
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Antigen
description:
A substance that triggers an immune response
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Macrophage
description:
A phagocytic immune cell
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Dendritic Cell
description:
A key antigen-presenting cell
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: T Cell
description:
A white blood cell involved in immunity
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: B Cell
description:
A white blood cell that produces antibodies
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Natural Killer Cell
description:
A cell that kills infected cells
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Cytokine
description:
A signaling protein in immunity
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Complement System
description:
A system that enhances immune responses
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Inflammation
description:
A protective immune reaction
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Phagocytosis
description:
Engulfing pathogens
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Immunological Memory
description:
A memory-based immune response
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Passive Immunity
description:
Immunity transferred from another source
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Active Immunity
description:
Immunity acquired by infection or vaccination
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Mucosal Immunity
description:
Immune defense at mucosal surfaces
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Toll-Like Receptor
description:
A receptor detecting pathogens
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Pathogen-Associated Molecular Pattern
description:
A molecular pattern recognized by immunity
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Major Histocompatibility Complex
description:
A gene complex controlling immune responses
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Vaccine
description:
A substance that stimulates immunity
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Immunosuppression
description:
A suppressed immune response
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Autoimmunity
description:
An immune attack on self-tissues
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Hypersensitivity
description:
An overreaction of the immune system
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Allergy
description:
An immune overreaction to allergens
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Anaphylaxis
description:
A severe allergic reaction
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Immunodeficiency
description:
A weakened immune system
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Immune Tolerance
description:
The body's ability to ignore harmless antigens
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Cytotoxic T Lymphocyte
description:
A T cell that kills infected cells
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Regulatory T Cell
description:
A T cell that regulates immune responses
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Interferon
description:
An antiviral protein
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Tumor Necrosis Factor
description:
A protein involved in inflammation
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Histamine
description:
A compound involved in allergic reactions
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Parasitic Castration
description:
Parasite-induced sterilization
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Host Manipulation
description:
Parasite modifies host behavior
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Parasitoid
description:
Parasite that eventually kills the host
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Haemoparasite
description:
Parasite infecting blood cells
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Opportunistic Parasite
description:
Parasite that infects only when conditions allow
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Commensalism
description:
One species benefits, the other is unharmed
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Mutualism
description:
Both species benefit
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Parasitic Adaptation
description:
Traits enabling parasitism
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Vector Competence
description:
Ability of vector to transmit pathogen
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Superinfection
description:
A new infection in a previously infected host
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Coinfection
description:
Infection by multiple pathogens
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Parasite Load
description:
Total number of parasites in a host
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Microbiota
description:
Microbial community in a host
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Immunoevasion
description:
Avoidance of immune detection
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Parasitic Mimicry
description:
Mimicking host molecules to evade immunity
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Life Cycle Plasticity
description:
Ability to alter life cycle stages
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Transmission Dynamics
description:
Factors affecting parasite spread
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Horizontal Transmission
description:
Transmission between unrelated hosts
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Vertical Transmission
description:
Transmission from parent to offspring
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Host Resistance
description:
Host’s ability to resist infection
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Host Susceptibility
description:
Host’s vulnerability to infection
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Pathogen Shedding
description:
Release of pathogens from a host
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Reservoir Competence
description:
Ability of reservoir host to spread disease
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Prepatent Period
description:
Time before parasites become detectable
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Patent Period
description:
Time during which parasites are detectable
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Host Immunomodulation
description:
Parasite modulates host immunity
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Parasite-Induced Immunosuppression
description:
Parasite suppresses immune system
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Cytopathic Effect
description:
Cellular damage caused by a pathogen
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Host-Pathogen Coevolution
description:
Mutual evolutionary changes in host and pathogen
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Immune Evasion Strategy
description:
Parasite strategies to evade immunity
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Hendra Virus
description:
Paramyxovirus from horses and bats
Example: Toxoplasma-infected rodents

title: Seoul Virus
description:
Hantavirus carried by rats
Example: Wasp larvae in caterpillars

title: Borna Disease
description:
Viral infection affecting the nervous system
Example: Plasmodium in RBCs

title: Tick-Borne Encephalitis
description:
Viral encephalitis from ticks
Example: Barnacle on crab

title: Orf Virus
description:
